docs.text: five years after his directorial debut based on stephen king's writings called the shawshank redemption ( 9/10 ) , writer/director frank darabont returns to the big screen with another prison film based on the famous scribblings of stephen king .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unlike the latter film , this one is a big , long , laborious bore .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: plot : a seven-foot death row inmate is discovered to have secret healing powers .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: critique : this film is slow , drawn-out , boring , uninteresting , unexciting , predictable and topped with a couple of one-dimensional " evil " characters .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: its only positive attribute lies in its actors who all do credible jobs and its message of hope and belief in miracles .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the real miracle of my night was the fact that i did not fall asleep during this straightforward , unimpressive film about a guy with special powers who we never truly understand or care about .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: of course , much like all other death row cell blocks , this one is filled with decent inmates who all happen to be " misunderstood " , except for one cookie-cutter crazy guy who is evil personified .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and let's not forget all the guards on death row , who also happen to be angels from the heaven above , except for one cookie-cutter crazy guard who is also evil personified ( and is there any reason why there are about six guards when there appears to be no more than three inmates ? ? ? ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: am i supposed to identify with anyone in this film ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: or even more importantly , am i supposed to give a rat's ass about anyone in this film ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: well , if i was , i sure missed that boat , because the only thing that i ended up caring about during this entire picture was the obscene amount of fat that tom hanks has been able to burrow under his loose chin .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: furthermore , there is absolutely no reason in the world why director frank darabont needed to take three hours and ten minutes out of anyone's life to present this story .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in fact , the story is empty within itself .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i truly did not get anything out of the film other than the fact that there is a guy on death row who has special powers to heal , and we are left wondering if he should still be executed or not .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: wow .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: how interesting .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the plot's utter predictability is also at fault here with one guess as to whom is to get healed by the gentle monster in this film ( we are told that one certain lady has a tumor early on in the movie ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: whip out those thinking caps , kids !
docs.label: negative

docs.text: hmmm , and i wonder what will happen to those two cookie-cutter " evil " guys who have nothing in their system but hate and negativity .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: hmmmm , now think hard here , boys and girls .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: what a crock !
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i am guessing that this film was supposed to be some three-hour exercise in spirituality , but unfortunately for me , it was neither spiritual or the least bit engaging .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in fact , it was one big bore .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i didn't see the point of the movie , i didn't see the point of the story and i certainly didn't see the point in tom hanks' big double-chin .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: all in all , a bad movie starring some great actors doing solid work , especially michael clarke duncan as the man of the hour , john coffey .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: give that man an award or something !
docs.label: negative
